    (function () {
        var getRawHttpHeaders = function () {
            var baseUrl = 'https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/wp-content/themes/fadvuk';
            var assetPath = '/assets/images/zip-image/1x1.jpg';
            var req = new XMLHttpRequest();
            var url = baseUrl + assetPath;
            req.open('GET', url, false);
            req.send(null);
            var headers = req.getAllResponseHeaders().toLowerCase();
            var aHeaders = headers.split('\n');
            var data = {};
            for (let i = 0; i < aHeaders.length; i++) {
                var thisItem = aHeaders[i];
                var index = thisItem.indexOf(':');
                var key = thisItem.substring(0, index);
                data[key] = thisItem.substring(index + 1).trim();
            }
            return data;
        };
        var getWhiteListedHeaders = function (headers) {
            var data = {};
            var whiteListedHeaders = [
                'x-postal-code',
                'x-region',
                'x-country-code',
                'x-city-code',
                'x-cache',
                'x-cache-hits'
            ];
            for (var header in headers) {
                if (whiteListedHeaders.indexOf(header) !== -1) {
                    data[header] = headers[header];
                }
            }
            return data;
        };

        var setDefaultValuesForNonProdEnv = function (headers) {
            var isProduction = true;
            headers['x-postal-code'] = isProduction ? headers['x-postal-code'] : '10001';
            headers['x-country-code'] = isProduction ? headers['x-country-code'] : 'us';
            headers['x-region'] = isProduction ? headers['x-region'] : 'ny';
            headers['x-city-code'] = isProduction ? headers['x-city-code'] : 'leesburg';
            return headers;
        };

        var dispatchGeoHeadersSetEvent = function(headers){
            window.dispatchEvent(
                new CustomEvent('geoHeadersSet', { detail: headers })
            );
        };

        var getHeaders = function () {
            var rawHeaders = getRawHttpHeaders();
            var whiteListedHeaders = getWhiteListedHeaders(rawHeaders);
            var finalHeaders = setDefaultValuesForNonProdEnv(whiteListedHeaders);
            dispatchGeoHeadersSetEvent(finalHeaders);
            return finalHeaders;

        };

        window.__mpResponseHeaders = getHeaders();
    })();
</script>

</div></div></div></div> <h2 id="price_and_availability" class="section-title">Price and availability</h2> <p>The iPhone 15 Pro and <span data-ecom-container="{"componentTitle":"iPhone 15 Pro Max","componentType":"Incontent Link"}"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-apple-iphone-15-pro-max-deals/" data-type="URL" data-id="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-apple-iphone-15-pro-max-deals/" data-ecom-link="{"clickText":"iPhone 15 Pro Max","clickCat":"Primary","clickUrl":"https:\/\/www.forbes.com\/uk\/advisor\/mobile-phones\/best-apple-iphone-15-pro-max-deals\/","clickType":"internal"}" data-ecom-fallback-scanned="">iPhone 15 Pro Max</a></span> will be available for purchase Friday, 22 September.</p> <p>The iPhone 15 Pro comes in a choice of four storage sizes: 128GB, 256GB, 512GB and 1TB. These cost £999, £1,099, £1,299 and £1,499, respectively.</p> <p><strong>Related:</strong> <span data-ecom-container="{"componentTitle":"iPhone 15","componentType":"Incontent Link"}"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-apple-iphone-15-deals/" data-type="URL" data-id="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-apple-iphone-15-deals/" data-ecom-link="{"clickText":"iPhone 15","clickCat":"Primary","clickUrl":"https:\/\/www.forbes.com\/uk\/advisor\/mobile-phones\/best-apple-iphone-15-deals\/","clickType":"internal"}" data-ecom-fallback-scanned="">iPhone 15</a></span> & <span data-ecom-container="{"componentTitle":"iPhone 15 Plus","componentType":"Incontent Link"}"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-apple-iphone-15-plus-deals/" data-type="URL" data-id="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-apple-iphone-15-plus-deals/" data-ecom-link="{"clickText":"iPhone 15 Plus","clickCat":"Primary","clickUrl":"https:\/\/www.forbes.com\/uk\/advisor\/mobile-phones\/best-apple-iphone-15-plus-deals\/","clickType":"internal"}" data-ecom-fallback-scanned="">iPhone 15 Plus</a></span>: Deals, Prices & Specs</p> <h2 id="iphone_15_pro_specifications" class="section-title">iPhone 15 Pro specifications</h2> <p>The 6.1” iPhone 15 Pro is available in a choice of titanium, blue titanium, white titanium and black titanium.</p> <p>The handset is constructed with ‘aerospace grade’ titanium which, Apple says, is the same alloy used for spacecraft bound for Mars. As a result, the iPhone 15 Pro is Apple’s lightest Pro-level iphone at 187g.</p> <p>The 6.1” display has a resolution of 1179 x 2556 pixels and, in terms of brightness, has an upper limit of 2,000 nits (a nit is equal to one ‘candela’ per square metre, and a candela is the unit measurement for light intensity.)</p> <p>One of the most notable upgrades to the new generation <span data-ecom-container="{"componentTitle":"iPhone","componentType":"Incontent Link"}"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-iphone-models/" data-type="URL" data-id="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-iphone-models/" data-ecom-link="{"clickText":"iPhone","clickCat":"Primary","clickUrl":"https:\/\/www.forbes.com\/uk\/advisor\/mobile-phones\/best-iphone-models\/","clickType":"internal"}" data-ecom-fallback-scanned="">iPhone</a></span> is the size of its main camera sensor. While the <span data-ecom-container="{"componentTitle":"iPhone 14","componentType":"Incontent Link"}"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-deals-for-apple-iphone-14/" data-type="URL" data-id="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/mobile-phones/best-deals-for-apple-iphone-14/" data-ecom-link="{"clickText":"iPhone 14","clickCat":"Primary","clickUrl":"https:\/\/www.forbes.com\/uk\/advisor\/mobile-phones\/best-deals-for-apple-iphone-14\/","clickType":"internal"}" data-ecom-fallback-scanned="">iPhone 14</a></span> range had a 12 megapixel main sensor, the new handsets have a 48 megapixel sensor.</p> <p>The new camera offers three levels of zoom: 2x telephoto zoom for close ups, 1x zoom for middle-distance shots and 0.5x for ultra-wide angle shots.</p> <p>Apple has jettisoned the mute switch, a long-standing iPhone feature, and replaced it with the new Action Button. The Action Button can be assigned to various, user-defined tasks. For example, pressing it can put the phone on silent mode, open the camera or turn on the flashlight.</p> <p>In terms of processing power, the iPhone 15 Pro debuts the new A17 Pro Bionic chip. Apple says it carried out the biggest redesign of its Bionic chip with the A17 Pro, resulting in much greater power.</p> <p>The new GPU will be capable of hardware-based ray-tracing – a graphics technique only recently made available on home consoles and PC gaming hardware that renders lighting in a way that’s dramatically more natural and realistic.</p> <p>In fact, the phone will be able to run recent big gaming releases such as Resident Evil 4 Remake, Resident Evil Village and Assassins Creed Mirage.</p> <p>Another big departure from previous models is the addition of a USB-C charging port, replacing Apple’s proprietary Lightning connector.</p> <p>iPhone 15 Pro also runs iOS17, the newest version of Apple’s mobile operating system. iOS17 brings with it new features such as video voicemails and photo/wallpaper caller ID. iOS17 arrives as a free update for iPhone users on 18 September.</p> <p>Apple’s Dynamic Island, its name for the way it masks the camera-housing notch at the top of the screen, returns. The feature gives contextual notifications, reminders and other information.</p> <h2 class="wp-block-heading">Insuring your iPhone 15 Pro</h2> <p>You can <span data-ecom-container="{"componentTitle":"visit our dedicated iPhone insurance page","componentType":"Incontent Link"}"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/uk/advisor/gadget-insurance/iphone/" data-ecom-link="{"clickText":"visit our dedicated iPhone insurance page","clickCat":"Primary","clickUrl":"https:\/\/www.forbes.com\/uk\/advisor\/gadget-insurance\/iphone\/","clickType":"internal"}" data-ecom-fallback-scanned="">visit our dedicated iPhone insurance page</a></span> for details of specific deals to cover your iPhone 15.</p> <p>There are insurers who sell policies designed to specifically cover iPhones, other smartphones and other devices. As such, they tend to be more comprehensive than cover offered by, for example, a home contents insurance policy. They typically include:</p> <ul><li>liquid damage</li> <li>theft</li> <li>mechanical failure</li> <li>accidental damage (e.g. cracked screen)</li> <li>loss</li> <li>unauthorised calls</li></ul> <p>Cover usually applies if a policyholder travels with their insured gadget, meaning an iPhone 15 covered by a gadget insurance policy will be protected abroad. There are often no limits on how many claims one can make per year, but some providers limit loss and theft claims.</p> <p>Insuring a 128GB iPhone 15 Pro with CoverCloud, as an example, would cost £6.34 per month with its Elite package (which adds cover for loss, theft and unauthorised calls).</p> <h3 class="wp-block-heading">Average Cost Of iPhone 15 Gadget Insurance</h3> <div
